panels.description: The report contains comparative measurements number of running virtual machines and OS usage in for a selected cluster within the requested period.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT DISTINCT
    NOW () AS time,
    COALESCE (
        os_type,
        'RHEL'
    )
    AS os_type,
    vm_count
FROM (
    SELECT DISTINCT
        CASE
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) = 'OTHER OS'
                THEN 'Other OS'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE '%WINDOWS%'
                THEN 'Windows'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'RHEL%'
                THEN 'RHEL'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'RED HAT%'
                THEN 'RHEL'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'OTHER L%'
                THEN 'Other Linux'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'LINUX'
                THEN 'Other Linux'
            WHEN UPPER (COALESCE( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE '%UBUNTU%'
                THEN 'Other Linux'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE '%SUSE%'
                THEN 'Other Linux'
            ELSE 'Other OS'
        END
        AS os_type,
        hourly_daily.history_datetime AS time,
        COUNT ( DISTINCT v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id ) AS vm_count
    FROM 
        (
            SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
            UNION
            SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
        ) AS hourly_daily

        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id =
                hourly_daily.vm_configuration_version
            )
        INNER JOIN enum_translator enum_os_type
            ON (
                enum_os_type.enum_key =
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.operating_system
                AND enum_os_type.enum_type = 'OS_TYPE'
                AND language_code = 'en_US'
            )
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms latest_config
            ON (
                latest_config.vm_id =
                hourly_daily.vm_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter only the vms that are in active status
        hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
    -- Filter vms list according to the cluster that was chosen by the user
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id IN (
            SELECT v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
            WHERE
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id IN ($cluster_id) )
        
        -- Here we get the vm latest configuration
        AND latest_config.history_id IN
            (
                SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms b
                GROUP BY b.vm_id
            )
       AND hourly_daily.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
       AND hourly_daily.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
       AND
            -- This will determine where deleted entities will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            CASE
                WHEN '$show_deleted' = 'No'
                    THEN latest_config.delete_date IS NULL
                ELSE
                    latest_config.delete_date IS NULL
                    OR
                    latest_config.delete_date IS NOT NULL
            END
    GROUP BY
        CASE
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) = 'OTHER OS'
                THEN 'Other OS'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like '%WINDOWS%'
                THEN 'Windows'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'RHEL%'
                THEN 'RHEL'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'RED HAT%'
                THEN 'RHEL'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'OTHER L%'
                THEN 'Other Linux'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'LINUX'
                THEN 'Other Linux'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like '%UBUNTU%'
                THEN 'Other Linux'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like '%SUSE%'
                THEN 'Other Linux'
            ELSE 'Other OS'
        END,
        hourly_daily.History_datetime
)
AS all_query
ORDER BY os_type, time

panels.title: Active Virtual Machines by OS (BR18)

panels.description: The report contains comparative measurements of number of running virtual machines and OS usage for a selected cluster within the requested period.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(time),
    COALESCE (
        os_type,
        'RHEL'
    )
    AS os_type,
    vm_count
FROM (
    SELECT DISTINCT
        CASE
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) = 'OTHER OS'
                THEN 'Other OS'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE '%WINDOWS%'
                THEN 'Windows'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'RHEL%'
                THEN 'RHEL'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'RED HAT%'
                THEN 'RHEL'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'OTHER L%'
                THEN 'Other Linux'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'LINUX'
                THEN 'Other Linux'
            WHEN UPPER (COALESCE( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE '%UBUNTU%'
                THEN 'Other Linux'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE '%SUSE%'
                THEN 'Other Linux'
            ELSE 'Other OS'
        END
        AS os_type,
        hourly_daily.history_datetime AS time,
        COUNT ( DISTINCT v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id ) AS vm_count
    FROM 
        (
            SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
            UNION
            SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
        ) AS hourly_daily

        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id =
                hourly_daily.vm_configuration_version
            )
        INNER JOIN enum_translator enum_os_type
            ON (
                enum_os_type.enum_key =
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.operating_system
                AND enum_os_type.enum_type = 'OS_TYPE'
                AND language_code = 'en_US'
            )
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms latest_config
            ON (
                latest_config.vm_id =
                hourly_daily.vm_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter only the vms that are in active status
        hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
    -- Filter vms list according to the cluster that was chosen by the user
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id IN (
            SELECT v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
            WHERE
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id IN ($cluster_id) )
        
        -- Here we get the vm latest configuration
        AND latest_config.history_id IN
            (
                SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms b
                GROUP BY b.vm_id
            )
       AND hourly_daily.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
       AND hourly_daily.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
       AND
            -- This will determine where deleted entities will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            CASE
                WHEN '$show_deleted' = 'No'
                    THEN latest_config.delete_date IS NULL
                ELSE
                    latest_config.delete_date IS NULL
                    OR
                    latest_config.delete_date IS NOT NULL
            END
    GROUP BY
        CASE
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) = 'OTHER OS'
                THEN 'Other OS'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like '%WINDOWS%'
                THEN 'Windows'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'RHEL%'
                THEN 'RHEL'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'RED HAT%'
                THEN 'RHEL'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'OTHER L%'
                THEN 'Other Linux'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'LINUX'
                THEN 'Other Linux'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like '%UBUNTU%'
                THEN 'Other Linux'
            WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like '%SUSE%'
                THEN 'Other Linux'
            ELSE 'Other OS'
        END,
        hourly_daily.History_datetime
)
AS all_query
ORDER BY os_type, time

panels.title: Active Virtual Machines by OS Over Time (BR18)

panels.description: This report display the number of hosts for each OS version for a selected cluster within a requested period.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT DISTINCT
    NOW () AS time,
    COALESCE ( os_type, MAX ( os_type ) over (partition by 1), '' ) AS os_type,
    host_count
FROM (
    SELECT
      
        COALESCE 
        (
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_os,
            'Unknown'
        ) AS os_type,
        hourly_daily.history_datetime AS time,
        COUNT ( DISTINCT hourly_daily.host_id )
        AS host_count
    FROM  
        (
           SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
           union
           SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
        ) AS hourly_daily
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts 
             ON (
               v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                hourly_daily.host_id
                )
       
    WHERE
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id IN (
        SELECT v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
        WHERE
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id IN ($cluster_id) )

        AND hourly_daily.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND hourly_daily.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts 
            GROUP BY v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id
        )

        AND
            CASE
                WHEN '$show_deleted' = 'No'
                    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date IS NULL
                ELSE
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date IS NULL
                    OR
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date IS NOT NULL
            END
    GROUP BY
      COALESCE 
        (
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_os,
            'Unknown'
        ),time
) AS from_sub_query

ORDER BY time

panels.title: Host OS Break Down (BR22)

panels.description: This report display the number of hosts for each OS version for a selected cluster within a requested period.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(time),
    COALESCE ( os_type, MAX ( os_type ) over (partition by 1), '' ) AS os_type,
    host_count
FROM (
    SELECT
      
        COALESCE 
        (
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_os,
            'Unknown'
        ) AS os_type,
        hourly_daily.history_datetime AS time,
        COUNT ( DISTINCT hourly_daily.host_id )
        AS host_count
    FROM  
        (
           SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
           union
           SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
        ) AS hourly_daily
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts 
               ON (
               v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                hourly_daily.host_id
                  )
       
    WHERE
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id IN (
        SELECT v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
        WHERE
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id IN ($cluster_id) )

        AND hourly_daily.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND hourly_daily.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts 
            GROUP BY v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id
        )

        AND
            CASE
                WHEN '$show_deleted' = 'No'
                    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date IS NULL
                ELSE
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date IS NULL
                    OR
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date IS NOT NULL
            END
    GROUP BY
      COALESCE 
        (
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_os,
            'Unknown'
        ),time
) AS from_sub_query

ORDER BY time

panels.title: Host OS Break Down Over Time (BR22)

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_name AS __text , datacenter_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters
list.label: Data Center
list.name: datacenter_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_name AS __text , datacenter_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT cluster_name AS __text, cluster_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters WHERE datacenter_id IN  ('$datacenter_id')

list.query: SELECT DISTINCT cluster_name AS __text, cluster_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters WHERE datacenter_id IN  ('$datacenter_id')
